body:
This PR is certainly an improvement, but we're still missing a lot of documentation that we need.  I've added some comments pointing out some of what we're missing, but the general rule is that we need to fully document anything that end users will directly use in their application code.

Please let me know if you have any questions about any of this.  Thanks!

---

Reviewed 25 of 28 files at r1, 14 of 15 files at r2, 33 of 33 files at r3.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 23 unresolved discussions.

---

*[doc/service_config.md, line 134 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOYYbWNyFzMvxY6DUW:-KjOYYbWNyFzMvxY6DUX:b-n6t569) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/doc/service_config.md#L134)):*
> ```Markdown
> # Architecture
> 
> A service config is associated with a server name.  The [nameresolver](naming.md)
> ```

"name resolver" is two words, not one.  Please revert that change.

---

*[include/grpc++/health_check_service_interface.h, line 63 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOYqyEiMRDqQKneOXh:-KjOYqyEiMRDqQKneOXi:b-yoq55b) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/health_check_service_interface.h#L63)):*
> ```objc
> void EnableDefaultHealthCheckService(bool enable);
> 
> /// NOT thread safe.
> ```

Please add:

```
/// Returns whether the default health checking service is enabled.
```

---

*[include/grpc++/resource_quota.h, line 50 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOZ7FCVRfMXhWEclBA:-KjOZ7FCVRfMXhWEclBB:biswqvk) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/resource_quota.h#L50)):*
> ```objc
> class ResourceQuota final : private GrpcLibraryCodegen {
>  public:
>   // \param name - a unique name for this ResourceQuota.
> ```

Need an additional slash here.

---

*[include/grpc++/generic/generic_stub.h, line 53 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOZXJbRSK-UXtFUcH9:-KjOZXJbRSK-UXtFUcHA:bsovakj) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/generic/generic_stub.h#L53)):*
> ```objc
>       : channel_(channel) {}
> 
>   /// begin a call to a named method
> ```

We need descriptions of individual methods to be much more comprehensive.  What are each of the parameters?  What are the semantics of the call?  What are the failure modes, and how does the application have to handle them?

Here's an example (I don't know if the description I'm giving here is actually correct -- please find out and document it accordingly):

```
/// Begins a call to the method named \a method using \a context.
/// When the call is ready, \a tag will be delivered to \a cq.
/// The return value may not be used until the tag is delivered to
/// the completion queue with ok==true.
```

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/server_builder_plugin.h, line 46 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOa-0b4cor265JoLz1:-KjOa-0b4cor265JoLz2:bgdhciy) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/server_builder_plugin.h#L46)):*
> ```objc
> class ChannelArguments;
> 
> class ServerBuilderPlugin {
> ```

Please add a comment describing what this class represents and how it is expected to be used.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h, line 144 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOeVE8M05ji3T_pAgt:-KjOeVE8M05ji3T_pAgu:b-9162sf) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h#L144)):*
> ```objc
> 
> template <class R>
> class ClientAsyncReader final : public ClientAsyncReaderInterface<R> {
> ```

Please add a comment describing what this class is used for.  For example:

/// Used in the client async API for server-side streaming RPCs.

Same thing for all non-abstract classes in this file.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h, line 158 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOckSMbfrGVzOU2ht8:-KjOckSMbfrGVzOU2ht9:bvm96ok) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h#L158)):*
> ```objc
>   }
> 
>   /// always allocated against a call arena, no memory free required
> ```

It looks like Doxygen isn't generating documentation for the delete operator at all, so it's probably not necessary to add the extra slash for these functions.

As a general rule, what we're really after here is improving documentation that is useful to users.  Users probably don't need to care about the details of how we're doing memory allocation; what they do need to care about is how they are expected to use the class, what the failure modes are, etc.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_unary_call.h, line 51 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOd60r1y2oB5q6mCJi:-KjOd60r1y2oB5q6mCJj:b19tmwo) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_unary_call.h#L51)):*
> ```objc
> 
> template <class R>
> class ClientAsyncResponseReaderInterface {
> ```

Need documentation for this class and its methods, similar to what exists in async_stream.h.

As an example, compare what Doxygen currently shows for the ClientAsyncResponseReader class:

http://www.grpc.io/grpc/cpp/classgrpc_1_1_client_async_response_reader.html

to what it shows for the ClientAsyncWriter class:

http://www.grpc.io/grpc/cpp/classgrpc_1_1_client_async_writer.html

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_unary_call.h, line 59 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOfznV5Ltk5mue5Ldh:-KjOfznV5Ltk5mue5Ldi:b-9zfxpj) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_unary_call.h#L59)):*
> ```objc
> 
> template <class R>
> class ClientAsyncResponseReader final
> ```

Please document what this class is for.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_unary_call.h, line 74 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOdEWLHFlj6iEJ3MpQ:-KjOdEWM6y4GH42yySsJ:bjkky9h) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_unary_call.h#L74)):*
> ```objc
>   }
> 
>   /// always allocated against a call arena, no memory free required
> ```

Extra slash not needed for delete method.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_unary_call.h, line 127 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOg1hUp--fk271hO6I:-KjOg1hUp--fk271hO6J:b-9zfxpj) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_unary_call.h#L127)):*
> ```objc
> 
> template <class W>
> class ServerAsyncResponseWriter final : public ServerAsyncStreamingInterface {
> ```

Please document what this class is for.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/client_context.h, line 154 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOhRoySLgHGIjdKAuH:-KjOhRoz-yvz868zXiPa:b-mdklya) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/client_context.h#L154)):*
> ```objc
> }  // namespace testing
> 
> /// Gives access to client side RPC configuration.
> ```

Need a much more detailed description here.  For example, this should describe the fact that there needs to be one ClientContext per RPC and that ClientContext objects cannot be reused.  It should also give some examples of the sorts of things that are accessible via the ClientContext.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/client_context.h, line 226 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOitOV4tsoGgSbSlSj:-KjOitOV4tsoGgSbSlSk:b-98y0ww) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/client_context.h#L226)):*
> ```objc
>   }
> 
>   /// EXPERIMENTAL: Set this request to be idempotent
> ```

What is this used for?  What does it mean for a request to be idempotent?

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/client_context.h, line 229 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOixSg0ljIUT6ZwasU:-KjOixSg0ljIUT6ZwasV:brhumzt) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/client_context.h#L229)):*
> ```objc
>   void set_idempotent(bool idempotent) { idempotent_ = idempotent; }
> 
>   /// EXPERIMENTAL: Set this request to be cacheable
> ```

Same here.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/client_context.h, line 232 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOiyrbkhiXOLSVi5AE:-KjOiyrbkhiXOLSVi5AF:b-m3aymx) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/client_context.h#L232)):*
> ```objc
>   void set_cacheable(bool cacheable) { cacheable_ = cacheable; }
> 
>   /// EXPERIMENTAL: Trigger wait-for-ready or not on this request
> ```

What does wait_for_ready do?

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h, line 94 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOk5ZO-YSnMQ7lKDbx:-KjOk5ZO-YSnMQ7lKDby:b364deg) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h#L94)):*
> ```objc
> }  // namespace testing
> 
> /// Interface of server side rpc context.
> ```

Same comments as for ClientContext.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h, line 100 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOkT8ogSs_puDryDeL:-KjOkT8ogSs_puDryDeM:be9t2se) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h#L100)):*
> ```objc
>   ~ServerContext();
> 
>   std::chrono::system_clock::time_point deadline() const {
> ```

Please document every public method in this class.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h, line 109 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOkEhKfOfOHjPQw1p9:-KjOkEhKfOfOHjPQw1pA:b-my74rn) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h#L109)):*
> ```objc
>   void AddTrailingMetadata(const grpc::string& key, const grpc::string& value);
> 
>   /// IsCancelled is always safe to call when using sync API
> ```

Please put a period at the end of each complete sentence.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h, line 114 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOkKgjQU-OlusJ2QNS:-KjOkKgjQU-OlusJ2QNT:bddyray) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h#L114)):*
> ```objc
>   bool IsCancelled() const;
> 
>   // Cancel the Call from the server. This is a best-effort API and depending on
> ```

Each of the lines in this comment need an additional slash.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h, line 158 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOkYFaJ0SOJDQV_R1I:-KjOkYFaJ0SOJDQV_R1J:bp24e6d) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h#L158)):*
> ```objc
>   }
> 
>   // Return the peer uri in a string.
> ```

Need additional slash.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h, line 166 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOkZxj-dOwHUsmM7-n:-KjOkZxj-dOwHUsmM7-o:bp24e6d) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/server_context.h#L166)):*
> ```objc
>   const struct census_context* census_context() const;
> 
>   // Async only. Has to be called before the rpc starts.
> ```

Need additional slash.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/status_code_enum.h, line 144 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOkv60b9ndH-I5CQcV:-KjOkv60b9ndH-I5CQcW:bwyxh1k) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/status_code_enum.h#L144)):*
> ```objc
>   /// if the call is non-idempotent.
>   ///
>   ///
> ```

Please remove the extra blank line here.

---

*[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/sync_stream.h, line 152 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-KjOlIfManyebpPiUC1d:-KjOlIfN7_1cZxfroU6M:b-xbu7ga) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/9b7e3b3dea8825df87a81f1a05e2ee8f740290a0/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/sync_stream.h#L152)):*
> ```objc
> 
> template <class R>
> class ClientReader final : public ClientReaderInterface<R> {
> ```

Please document all non-abstract classes in this file.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-:-KjP39UDAIokxfMXvybJ:bfx1xxv)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Haven't finished completely cleaning up yet but I'm not planning any more content changes.

I think the main content of this ok for another look.

A note on the header comments especially in the `async_streams.h` file:
There were a lot of (especially `Finish`) methods that didn't seem to have an umbrella interface.
I wanted to avoid having one class to refer to a sibling, so currently there's a good amount of duplicate documentation there.

The content here looks fantastic! Thank you for doing this! The vast majority of my comments are minor grammar or formatting issues. I'm going to add Yang as a reviewer, to make sure that I haven't missed anything here. --- Reviewed 16 of 17 files at r4. Review status: 72 of 73 files reviewed at latest revision, 45 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[include/grpc/slice.h, line 170 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn-b49-YzcXtkKt854:-Kjn-b49-YzcXtkKt855:b-15wmgf) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc/slice.h#L170)):* > ```objc > /** return the index of the first occurance of \a needle in \a haystack, or -1 > * if > * it's not found */ > ``` Please merge this with the previous line. --- *[include/grpc++/generic/generic_stub.h, line 53 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn-vuFPKclByPVUtnA:-Kjn-vuFPKclByPVUtnB:bt9i8p5) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/generic/generic_stub.h#L53)):* > ```objc > : channel_(channel) {} > > /// Begin a call to a named method \a method usign \a context. > ``` s/usign/using/ --- *[include/grpc++/generic/generic_stub.h, line 54 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn00DSVZu77tfPOZYm:-Kjn00DSVZu77tfPOZYn:b-79yz43) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/generic/generic_stub.h#L54)):* > ```objc > > /// Begin a call to a named method \a method usign \a context. > /// A tag \a tag will be deliever to \a cq when the call has been started > ``` s/deliever/delivered/ --- *[include/grpc++/generic/generic_stub.h, line 57 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn0GulgUEu23Mtl5pK:-Kjn0GulgUEu23Mtl5pL:b-fmyuzc) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/generic/generic_stub.h#L57)):* > ```objc > /// (i.e, initial metadata has been sent). > /// The return value only indicates whether or not registration of the call > /// succeeded (i.e. the call won't proceed if the return value is 0). > ``` s/0/nullptr/ --- *[include/grpc++/impl/server_builder_plugin.h, line 47 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn0N4QHxv1bFp2tv1e:-Kjn0N4QHxv1bFp2tv1f:b-pwjd3n) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/impl/server_builder_plugin.h#L47)):* > ```objc > > /// A builder class for the creation and startup of \a grpc::Server instances. > /// This is interface is meant for internal usage only. Implementations of this > ``` s/This is/This/ --- *[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h, line 68 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn0ppxgJSd84AMklr9:-Kjn0ppxgJSd84AMklrA:b-lco203) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h#L68)):* > ```objc > /// * the client side has no more message to send (this can be declared implicitly > /// by calling this method, or explicitly through an earlier call to \a > /// WritesDone. > ``` Missing a trailing `)`. --- *[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h, line 68 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn0w4xIZmG-KHj5jco:-Kjn0w4xIZmG-KHj5jcp:be2v5nh) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h#L68)):* > ```objc > /// * the client side has no more message to send (this can be declared implicitly > /// by calling this method, or explicitly through an earlier call to \a > /// WritesDone. > ``` Maybe change this to refer to ClientAsyncWriterInterface::WritesDone, so that it's clear which method we're referring to? --- *[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h, line 71 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn1xTUehu061Sd62oc:-Kjn1xTUehu061Sd62od:btiviyc) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h#L71)):* > ```objc > /// * there are no more messages to be received from the server (which can > /// be known implicitly by the calling code, or known explicitly from an > /// earlier call to \a Read that yielded a failed result > ``` Similarly, I suggest changing this to refer to AsyncReaderInterface::Read(). --- *[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h, line 192 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn55rId1UbxqseFfkG:-Kjn55rJXbR509aUk4zt:b-1ujg39) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h#L192)):* > ```objc > } > > /// See the \a ClientAsyncStreamingInterface.ReadInitialMetadata method for > ``` Prior to this change, it looks like Doxygen was automatically propagating the description from the base class to the subclass: http://www.grpc.io/grpc/cpp/classgrpc_1_1_client_async_reader.html#a66e76c15ee94cf0c2892def9041210d1 Do you know what it will do if you add a description here? Will this description replace the one from the base class, or will it be appended to the one from the base class? If the former, then I wonder if it would be better to just put all of the documentation in the base classes and not override it in the subclasses, so that the user doesn't have to follow another link to see the description of the method. Same thing for all override methods. --- *[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h, line 267 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn8GqQ7JlZRoicwRWq:-Kjn8GqRMyHLXVYAipnv:b-s7yf18) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h#L267)):* > ```objc > }; > > /// Async API to on the client side for doing client-streaming RPCs, > ``` s/to // --- *[include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h, line 390 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/10992#-Kjn8zqni6c1JvCAUxfB:-Kjn8zqni6c1JvCAUxfC:b-de8z69) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/0f02908e67d637acfff579c2a97be20ebfca1b00/include/grpc++/impl/codegen/async_stream.h#L390)):* > ```objc > /// Async client-side interface for bi-directional thanks! Tried to respond to latest comments. A couple things that are still in question: * a lot of the bad line lengths and bad line breaks seem to be introduced by clang format. I tried fixing these where there was an obvious format problem in the latest commit. also for comment: > Prior to this change, it looks like Doxygen was automatically propagating the description from the base class to the subclass: I've seen through doxygen output that if there's any description in the concrete class, that only that is used. In most recent commits, I removed the reference links from descriptions that only contained reference links. But I kept them in other places, like e.g. in `async_stream.h`: ``` 196 /// See the \a ClientAsyncStreamingInterface.ReadInitialMetadata 197 /// method for semantics. 198 /// 199 /// Side effect: 200 /// - upon receiving initial metadata from the server, 201 /// the \a ClientContext associated with this call is updated, and the 202 /// calling code can access the received metadata through the 203 /// \a ClientContext. ``` where there was more info specific to the concrete class that seemed out of place in the interface. PLMK if this seems ok
